body.left_template:
General Documents for Adults

  1. Family composition From-54
  2. Passports All
  3. Recent Picture 1 copies (White Back Ground, size Passport, Matt Paper)
  4. Business Invitation
  5. Inviter Photo ID Card copy- if any
  6. NID color photocopy with Notary
  7. Bank Solvency Certificate & Statement last 6 Months
  8. Property Valuation – If Any
  9. Marriage Certificate, English Version - (If Bangla with Notary Must)
  10. Visiting Card
  11. Hotel Booking
  12. Air Ticket Booking
  13. Tour Itinerary
  14. Visa Request Letter (For Business person print with official pad & for service holders print with normal Paper)
  15. Office NOC - Service Holder
  16. Salary Certificate - Service Holder
  17. Last 4 Months Pay Slip – Service Holder
  18. Office ID Card Color copy
  19. Previous Job History with Certificate (If Any) - Service Holder
  20. Update Trade License with Notary – Business Person
  21. Company Memorandum - If Any -Business Person
  22. Export-Import License – If Any - Business Person
  23. Company TIN, BIN & Tax Return Certificate - Business Person
  24. Personal TIN & Tax Return Certificate
  25. Valid Membership Certificate of any trade body like FBCCI, DCCI, BGMEA, BKMEA, etc. – If Any

General Documents for Child

  1. Birth Certificate with Notary
  2. School ID card color copy - For Student
  3. NOC from School – Student

Visa Process Fees = 5000 BDT per Person

body.left_template:
General Documents for Business Visa

  1. Original Passport with validity of a minimum of six months after the intended date of departure and minimum of two blank pages for visa stamp.
  2. Copy of previous passports and visas issued.
  3. Attach all your old passports (if any).
  4. If any visa request was refused, details of original letter issued by the authorities of that country would be preferred.
  5. Visa application form must be filled and signed by the applicant.
  6. Two recent passport size photographs with matt or semi matt finish, 60-80% face coverage, white background and without border (Size: 35mm x 45mm)
  7. Covering Letter from applicant name, designation, Passport Number, purpose and outlining who will be responsible for the full costs of the trip – travel, accommodation, expenses etc. Addressed to – The Visa Officer, Embassy of Australia, Dhaka.
  8. Invitation letter form Australian host. (If Any)
  9. Forwarding Letter / NOC from the applicant’s company authority on the company’s letter head stating applicant’s name, designation, passport number, purpose and duration of visit.
  10. Visa request letter from the educational institute or student card/evidence of school enrollment (if student)
  11. Company registration certificate (original notarized
  12. English translated and photocopy of the original) if the applicant is a first time traveler or a proprietor.
  13. Office ID card copy & Visiting cards.
  14. Company’s or Personal Bank Statement for last six months mentioning the Bank’s name, Bank’s Telephone Number clearly.
  15. Salary slip for the last six months (If Any).
  16. Ticket Itinerary & Hotel Booking.

body.left_template:
Schengen (“C”-Type) visa application form, original Form must be duly filled in English or Italian, and signed by the applicant (if the applicant is a minor, the form must be signed by both parents or its legal guardian)

Business Documents
Covering Letter from applicant including name, designation, Passport Number, purpose and outlining who will be responsible for the full costs of the trip – travel, accommodation, expenses etc. Addressed to – The Visa Officer, Embassy of Austria, Dhaka.

Invitation letter from the company in Austria

Forwarding Letter / NOC from the applicant’s company authority on the company’s letter head stating applicant’s name, designation, passport number, purpose and duration of visit.

Visa request letter from the educational institute or student card/evidence of school enrollment (if student)

Company registration certificate (original notarized English translated and photocopy of the original) if the applicant is a first-time traveler or a proprietor.

Office ID card copy & Visiting cards.

Two recent and identical photos. Photos must be ICAO format (4.0 x 3.5 cm, color photo with white background, taken within the last 6 months)

Valid Passport, original + 1 copy of pages 2 and 3 only (i.e the pages containing only the passport data and personal data) Passport must be valid for at least 3 months after planned departure date from 

Schengen area. The passport must have at least two blank and unmarked visa pages. 

 

If visiting family or friends residing Invitation letter in the format that can be downloaded in the respective section of VFS Web page , proof of family/ties with the inviting person, copy of ID of inviting person and copy of residence permit if foreigner

 

If working: Employment letter , in original Letter from the employer in English on official company paper with stamp, signature and date, introducing the business person and clearly mentioning: address, telephone and fax numbers of the employing company; the name and position in the employing company of the countersigning officer; the name of the applicant, position, salary and years of service; approval for leave; confirmation of position after return 

 

In case the applicant is a self-employed: Trade licence issued by City Corporation and Incorporation Certificate issued by Office of Registrar of Joint Stock Company Income tax return TIN Certificate Company bank statement of the last 6 months

 

In case the applicant is a student: Proof of enrolment in educational establishment in Bangladesh Certificate of leave absence if travelling during school year. The certificate should mention full address, telephone number, permission of absence, name and function of the person granting permission If school trip: letter of the school mentioning the purpose, duration and destination of the trip

 

Proof of financial means of the applicant Personal bank statement issued by any bank operating in Bangladesh covering the last 6 months complemented by any other proof of financial solvency (credit card statements etc.). If the applicants does not have sufficient own financial means a bank fidejussion (Fidejussione Bancaria) issued by an Italian bank is necessary

 

Return airline ticket booking with Passenger Registration Number or Reservation Number and travel itinerary

 

Hotel Confirmation or any other documents proving accommodation for the whole period of stay in the Schengen member States

 

Travel Insurance Insurance must be valid for the whole Schengen area. The insurance must cover medical fees, hospitalization and repatriation costs up to 30,000 Euros. The insurance must fully cover the whole period of stay within the Schengen area. 

 

Documents related to civil status of the applicant For married applicants: marriage certificate (e.g.“Nika Namah” for muslims or marriage act for hindus, both translated in English) For divorced applicants: divorce certificate (e.g. “Talak Namah” for muslims in English) For widowers and widows: death certificate of the spouse in English

 

In case of minors applying for visa Consent of both parents or custodian if both parents are not travelling together Photocopy of passport of parents or legal guardian Proof of financial means of parents or legal guardian (see point 6) Original birth certificate of the minor issued by the relevant authority The status of “legal guardian” must be proven by documents issued by the relevant Bangladeshi Courts for minors 

 

For Non-Bangladeshi applicants: Further than all documents listed on the present check-list, Bangladeshi Residence Permit valid at least 3 months beyond the intended date of departure from the territory of the Member States
body.right_template_one:
Austria is a member of the Schengen countries. Citizen of Bangladesh requires Schengen visa for traveling to Austria.

Important visa information
The Embassy of France handles the visa matters of the Consulate of Austria. Please apply for your Schengen visa for Austria through the Embassy of France.

Embassy of France
Road 108, House 18
Gulshan 2,Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
General opening hours: Sunday to Thursday: 08.30-16.00
Phone: (+88) 02 5881 3811 – 14
Fax: (+88) 02 5881 3612
Email: francevisadhaka@gmail.com

General opening hours:   Sunday to Thursday:   08.30 – 16.00

Visa section of the France Embassy:
opening hours: Sunday to Thursday from 8:30 am to 10:30 am
Telephone: (+88) 02 5881 3811
Fax: (+88) 02 988 3851
Email: webmestre.dacca-amba@diplomatie.gouv.fr
Web: http://www.ambafrance-bd.org/-Accueil-Anglais- 

 

Austria Visa Application Centre, Dhaka accept application from residence in Bangladesh who wish to apply for a Long term visa to travel to Austria. All applications will be assessed by the Embassy of Austria at New Delhi only.

Austria Visa Application Centre
4th Floor, Delta Life Tower, Plot 37, Road 90,
Gulshan North, Dhaka-1212, Bangladesh
Submission schedule: 9:00 to 14:00. (Sunday -Thursday)
Passport retrieval schedule: 15:00 to 16:00. (Sunday – Thursday)
Information: Sunday to Thursday from 12:00 to 14:00 hours

Helpline: (+88) 09 606 777 111 & (+88) 09 666 911 387
Sunday to Thursday: 09:00 to 17:00 (except public holiday)
Email Id: info.austriabd@vfshelpline.com
body.right_template_two:
Schengen file processing along with appointment fee = 5000 BDT

Visa processing time is 10 to 15 working days (Time may vary depending on the applicant’s profile and the embassy actually processing time)

In case of minors applying for visa Consent of both parents or custodian if both parents are not travelling together Photocopy of passport of parents or legal guardian Proof of financial means of parents or legal guardian (see point 6) Original birth certificate of the minor issued by the relevant authority The status of “legal guardian” must be proven by documents issued by the relevant Bangladeshi Courts for minors 

 

For Non-Bangladeshi applicants: Further than all documents listed on the present check-list, Bangladeshi Residence Permit valid at least 3 months beyond the intended date of departure from the territory of the Member States

In case the applicant is a self-employed: Trade licence issued by City Corporation and Incorporation Certificate issued by Office of Registrar of Joint Stock Company Income tax return TIN Certificate Company bank statement of the last 6 months

 

In case the applicant is a student: Proof of enrolment in educational establishment in Bangladesh Certificate of leave absence if travelling during school year. Proof of financial means of the applicant Personal bank statement issued by any bank operating in Bangladesh covering the last 6 months complemented by any other proof of financial solvency (credit card statements etc.). Return airline ticket booking with Passenger Registration Number or Reservation Number and travel itinerary

 

Hotel Confirmation or any other documents proving accommodation for the whole period of stay in the Schengen member States

body.left_template:
General Documents

  1. Original Passport with validity of minimum of six months after the intended date of departure and minimum of two blank pages for visa stamp
  2. Include all your previous passports
  3. Visa Application Form
  4. Three recent passport-size photographs with matt or semi-matt finish
  5. Photographs should be white background, without a border 60-80% face coverage, (Size: 3.5 cm X 4.5 cm)
  6. Covering Letter from applicant including Name, Designation, Passport Number, purpose and outlining who will be responsible for the full costs of the trip – travel, accommodation, expenses etc. The letter should be addressed to – The Visa Officer, Embassy of Cambodia, New Delhi. Visa Category must be mentioned in the subject line.
  7. An invitation letter from the host / inviting Company in Cambodia on its letterhead stating the purpose of travel and duration of stay and should be duly signed with the signatory’s name, designation, and seal.
  8. A letter from the office such as a NOC/LOI letter on the organization’s letterhead pad stating the applicant’s name, designation, passport number, purpose, duration of visit, sponsorship status etc. Addressing to- The Visa Officer, Embassy of Cambodia, New Delhi.
  9. Trade license/Certificate of Incorporation/Memorandum (If self-employed/businessman)
  10. Office ID card copy/ Visiting card (3 copies)
  11. Original copy of Bank Statement (salary)/ Personal bank statement for last 6 months mentioning the Bank’s name, Bank’s Telephone Number clearly with authorized bank seal and signature (e-statement is not acceptable)
  12. Employer Company’s Bank Statement for last 6 months mentioning the Bank’s name, Bank’s Telephone Number clearly. (If the trip is sponsored by the employer)
  13. Return air ticket itinerary as per your travel period.
  14. Hotel booking as per your travel period
  15. Travel Insurance
  16. Vaccine Certificate

Covering Letter from applicant including name, designation, Passport Number, purpose and outlining who will be responsible for the full costs of the trip – travel, accommodation, expenses etc. Addressed to – The Visa Officer, Embassy of Czech Republic, Dhaka

Invitation letter from the company in Czech Republic.

Forwarding Letter / NOC from the applicant’s company authority on the company’s letter head stating applicant’s name, designation, passport number, purpose and duration of visit.

Visa request letter from the educational institute or student card/evidence of school enrollment (if student)

Company registration certificate (original notarized English translated and photocopy of the original) if the applicant is a first-time traveler or a proprietor.

Office ID card copy & Visiting cards.

 

Two recent and identical photos. Photos must be ICAO format (4.0 x 3.5 cm, color photo with white background, taken within the last 6 months)

Valid Passport, original + 1 copy of pages 2 and 3 only (i.e the pages containing only the passport data and personal data) Passport must be valid for at least 3 months after planned departure date from 

Schengen area. The passport must have at least two blank and unmarked visa pages. 

 

If visiting family or friends residing Invitation letter in the format that can be downloaded in the respective section of VFS Web page , proof of family/ties with the inviting person, copy of ID of inviting person and copy of residence permit if foreigner

 

If working: Employment letter , in original Letter from the employer in English on official company paper with stamp, signature and date, introducing the business person and clearly mentioning: address, telephone and fax numbers of the employing company; the name and position in the employing company of the countersigning officer; the name of the applicant, position, salary and years of service; approval for leave; confirmation of position after return 

 

In case the applicant is a self-employed: Trade licence issued by City Corporation and Incorporation Certificate issued by Office of Registrar of Joint Stock Company Income tax return TIN Certificate Company bank statement of the last 6 months

 

In case the applicant is a student: Proof of enrolment in educational establishment in Bangladesh Certificate of leave absence if travelling during school year. The certificate should mention full address, telephone number, permission of absence, name and function of the person granting permission If school trip: letter of the school mentioning the purpose, duration and destination of the trip

 

Proof of financial means of the applicant Personal bank statement issued by any bank operating in Bangladesh covering the last 6 months complemented by any other proof of financial solvency (credit card statements etc.). If the applicants does not have sufficient own financial means a bank fidejussion (Fidejussione Bancaria) issued by an Italian bank is necessary

 

Return airline ticket booking with Passenger Registration Number or Reservation Number and travel itinerary

 

Hotel Confirmation or any other documents proving accommodation for the whole period of stay in the Schengen member States

 

Travel Insurance Insurance must be valid for the whole Schengen area. The insurance must cover medical fees, hospitalization and repatriation costs up to 30,000 Euros. The insurance must fully cover the whole period of stay within the Schengen area. 

 

Documents related to civil status of the applicant For married applicants: marriage certificate (e.g.“Nika Namah” for muslims or marriage act for hindus, both translated in English) For divorced applicants: divorce certificate (e.g. “Talak Namah” for muslims in English) For widowers and widows: death certificate of the spouse in English

 

In case of minors applying for visa Consent of both parents or custodian if both parents are not travelling together Photocopy of passport of parents or legal guardian Proof of financial means of parents or legal guardian (see point 6) Original birth certificate of the minor issued by the relevant authority The status of “legal guardian” must be proven by documents issued by the relevant Bangladeshi Courts for minors 

 

For Non-Bangladeshi applicants: Further than all documents listed on the present check-list, Bangladeshi Residence Permit valid at least 3 months beyond the intended date of departure from the territory of the Member States

EMBASSY OF DENMARK, BANGLADESH
House 1, Road 51
Gulshan 2, Dhaka 1212
Bangladesh
Phone: (+88) 02 882 2499, (+88) 02 882 1799
Fax: (+880) 02 882 3638
E-mail: dacamb@um.dk
Website: http://bangladesh.um.dk/en

 Denmark is a member of the Schengen countries along with other countries. A Schengen visa issued for Denmark allows you to travel in all Schengen countries.

 Important Visa Information:
Denmark Visa Application Centre is handling the visa matters of the Royal Danish Embassy. Therefore, please apply for your Schengen visa for Denmark through Denmark Visa Application Centre. The processing time for a visa is approximately 4-6 weeks.

Denmark Visa Application Centre
4th Floor, Delta Life Tower,
Plot 37, Road 90, Gulshan North,
Dhaka-1212, Bangladesh
Call Centre number: (+88) 096 0677 7000 (using landline & mobile number),
and (+88) 096 6691 1386 (using only mobile number.)
Email: info.denmarkbd@vfshelpline.com
Website: http://www.vfsglobal.com/denmark/bangladesh/index.html

Submission schedule: 9:00 to 14:00. (Sunday -Thursday)
Passport retrieval schedule: 15:00 to 16:00. (Sunday – Thursday)
Information: Sunday to Thursday: 12:00 to 14:00 hours

body.left_template:
Schengen (“C”-Type) visa application form, original Form must be duly filled in English or Italian, and signed by the applicant (if the applicant is a minor, the form must be signed by both parents or its legal guardian)

Business Documents
Covering Letter from applicant name, designation, Passport Number, purpose and outlining who will be responsible for the full costs of the trip – travel, accommodation, expenses etc. Addressed to – The Visa Officer, Embassy of Estonia, Dhaka.

Invitation from the inviting company or organization stating the purpose of the journey (meetings, conferences, training or business related events).

Forwarding Letter / NOC from the applicant’s company authority on the company’s letter head stating applicant’s name, designation, passport number, purpose and duration of visit.

Visa request letter from the educational institute or student card/evidence of school enrollment (if student)

Company registration certificate (original notarized English translated and photocopy of the original) if the applicant is a first-time traveler or a proprietor.

Office ID card copy & Visiting cards.

Two recent and identical photos. Photos must be ICAO format (4.0 x 3.5 cm, color photo with white background, taken within the last 6 months)

Valid Passport, original + 1 copy of pages 2 and 3 only (i.e the pages containing only the passport data and personal data) Passport must be valid for at least 3 months after planned departure date from 

Schengen area. The passport must have at least two blank and unmarked visa pages. 

 

If visiting family or friends residing Invitation letter in the format that can be downloaded in the respective section of VFS Web page , proof of family/ties with the inviting person, copy of ID of inviting person and copy of residence permit if foreigner

 

If working: Employment letter , in original Letter from the employer in English on official company paper with stamp, signature and date, introducing the business person and clearly mentioning: address, telephone and fax numbers of the employing company; the name and position in the employing company of the countersigning officer; the name of the applicant, position, salary and years of service; approval for leave; confirmation of position after return 

 

In case the applicant is a self-employed: Trade licence issued by City Corporation and Incorporation Certificate issued by Office of Registrar of Joint Stock Company Income tax return TIN Certificate Company bank statement of the last 6 months

 

In case the applicant is a student: Proof of enrolment in educational establishment in Bangladesh Certificate of leave absence if travelling during school year. The certificate should mention full address, telephone number, permission of absence, name and function of the person granting permission If school trip: letter of the school mentioning the purpose, duration and destination of the trip

 

Proof of financial means of the applicant Personal bank statement issued by any bank operating in Bangladesh covering the last 6 months complemented by any other proof of financial solvency (credit card statements etc.). If the applicants does not have sufficient own financial means a bank fidejussion (Fidejussione Bancaria) issued by an Italian bank is necessary

 

Return airline ticket booking with Passenger Registration Number or Reservation Number and travel itinerary

 

Hotel Confirmation or any other documents proving accommodation for the whole period of stay in the Schengen member States

 

Travel Insurance Insurance must be valid for the whole Schengen area. The insurance must cover medical fees, hospitalization and repatriation costs up to 30,000 Euros. The insurance must fully cover the whole period of stay within the Schengen area. 

 

Documents related to civil status of the applicant For married applicants: marriage certificate (e.g.“Nika Namah” for muslims or marriage act for hindus, both translated in English) For divorced applicants: divorce certificate (e.g. “Talak Namah” for muslims in English) For widowers and widows: death certificate of the spouse in English

 

In case of minors applying for visa Consent of both parents or custodian if both parents are not travelling together Photocopy of passport of parents or legal guardian Proof of financial means of parents or legal guardian (see point 6) Original birth certificate of the minor issued by the relevant authority The status of “legal guardian” must be proven by documents issued by the relevant Bangladeshi Courts for minors 

 

For Non-Bangladeshi applicants: Further than all documents listed on the present check-list, Bangladeshi Residence Permit valid at least 3 months beyond the intended date of departure from the territory of the Member States

Gulshan North, Gulshan-2, Dhaka
Helpline No: (+88) 09 606 777 333, (Sunday to Thursday 09:00 to 17:00)
Email: info.swedenbd@vfshelpline.com
Website: www.vfsglobal.se/Bangladesh/Index.html
body.right_template_two:
Schengen file processing along with appointment fee = 5000 BDT

Visa processing time is 10 to 15 working days (Time may vary depending on the applicant’s profile and the embassy actually processing time)

body.left_template:
Schengen (“C”-Type) visa application form, original Form must be duly filled in English or Italian, and signed by the applicant (if the applicant is a minor, the form must be signed by both parents or its legal guardian)

 

Two recent and identical photos. Photos must be ICAO format (4.0 x 3.5 cm, color photo with white background, taken within the last 6 months)

Valid Passport, original + 1 copy of pages 2 and 3 only (i.e the pages containing only the passport data and personal data) Passport must be valid for at least 3 months after planned departure date from 

Schengen area. The passport must have at least two blank and unmarked visa pages. 

 

If visiting family or friends residing Invitation letter in the format that can be downloaded in the respective section of VFS Web page , proof of family/ties with the inviting person, copy of ID of inviting person and copy of residence permit if foreigner

 

If working: Employment letter , in original Letter from the employer in English on official company paper with stamp, signature and date, introducing the business person and clearly mentioning: address, telephone and fax numbers of the employing company; the name and position in the employing company of the countersigning officer; the name of the applicant, position, salary and years of service; approval for leave; confirmation of position after return 

 

In case the applicant is a self-employed: Trade licence issued by City Corporation and Incorporation Certificate issued by Office of Registrar of Joint Stock Company Income tax return TIN Certificate Company bank statement of the last 6 months

 

In case the applicant is a student: Proof of enrolment in educational establishment in Bangladesh Certificate of leave absence if travelling during school year. The certificate should mention full address, telephone number, permission of absence, name and function of the person granting permission If school trip: letter of the school mentioning the purpose, duration and destination of the trip

 

Proof of financial means of the applicant Personal bank statement issued by any bank operating in Bangladesh covering the last 6 months complemented by any other proof of financial solvency (credit card statements etc.). If the applicants does not have sufficient own financial means a bank fidejussion (Fidejussione Bancaria) issued by an Italian bank is necessary

 

Return airline ticket booking with Passenger Registration Number or Reservation Number and travel itinerary

 

Hotel Confirmation or any other documents proving accommodation for the whole period of stay in the Schengen member States

 

Travel Insurance Insurance must be valid for the whole Schengen area. The insurance must cover medical fees, hospitalization and repatriation costs up to 30,000 Euros. The insurance must fully cover the whole period of stay within the Schengen area. 

 

Documents related to civil status of the applicant For married applicants: marriage certificate (e.g.“Nika Namah” for muslims or marriage act for hindus, both translated in English) For divorced applicants: divorce certificate (e.g. “Talak Namah” for muslims in English) For widowers and widows: death certificate of the spouse in English

 

In case of minors applying for visa Consent of both parents or custodian if both parents are not travelling together Photocopy of passport of parents or legal guardian Proof of financial means of parents or legal guardian (see point 6) Original birth certificate of the minor issued by the relevant authority The status of “legal guardian” must be proven by documents issued by the relevant Bangladeshi Courts for minors 

 

For Non-Bangladeshi applicants: Further than all documents listed on the present check-list, Bangladeshi Residence Permit valid at least 3 months beyond the intended date of departure from the territory of the Member States
body.right_template_one:
inland is a member of the Schengen countries along with Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

Important visa information
The Embassy of Sweden is handling the visa matters of the Embassy of Finland. Therefore, please apply for your Schengen visa for Finland through the Embassy of Sweden. 

Embassy of Sweden
House 1, Road 51
Gulshan 2, Dhaka 1212
Bangldesh

General opening hours:
Sunday to Thursday:08.00-16.00
Telephone: (+88) 02 8833144-47
Fax: (+88) 02 8823948 

Visa section of the Swedish Embassy:
opening hours:
Sunday, Monday, Wednesday, Thursday:09.00-13.00
Telephone: (+88) 02 883 3148
Helpline No: (+88) 09 606 777 333, (Sunday to Thursday 09:00 to 17:00)
Telephone hours visa section:
Sunday, Monday, Wednesday, Thursday:15.00-16.00

The Swedish Embassy has an appointment system. In order to get an appointment you are required to visit the following external service provider (not applicable for online applications).

Sweden Visa Application Centre
Delta Life Tower, Plot 37, Road 90,
Gulshan North, Gulshan-2, Dhaka
Helpline No: (+88) 09 606 777 333, (Sunday to Thursday 09:00 to 17:00)
Email: info.swedenbd@vfshelpline.com
Website: www.vfsglobal.se/Bangladesh/Index.html

For Business Visa Additional Documents

Covering Letter from applicant name, designation, Passport Number, purpose and outlining who will be responsible for the full costs of the trip – travel, accommodation, expenses etc. Addressed to – The Visa Officer, Embassy of Finland, Dhaka

Invitation from the inviting company or organization stating the purpose of the journey (meetings, conferences, training or business related events).

Forwarding Letter / NOC from the applicant’s company authority on the company’s letter head stating applicant’s name, designation, passport number, purpose and duration of visit.

Visa request letter from the educational institute or student card/evidence of school enrollment (if student)

Company registration certificate (original notarized English translated and photocopy of the original) if the applicant is a first-time traveler or a proprietor.

Office ID card copy & Visiting cards.

body.right_template_one:
France Embassy in Dhaka 
Embassy of the Republic of France
Madani Avenue (Corner of Park Road)
Baridhara, Dhaka
Tel: +88 02 5566 8600, (+88) 02 5881 3811-14
Fax: (+88) 02 5882 3612

Email: https://france-visas.gouv.fr/en_US/web/france-visas/contact-us-support

Information about visas:

Compulsory appointments at the Visa section:

Due to an increase in the application number, the current waiting period to get an appointment with the visa section of this Embassy is 3 weeks. As it takes 1 week from the application date to process the visas, applicants are invited to take an appointment as soon as possible and to fix their plan accordingly.

As the Embassy of France issues biometric visas, the fingerprints must be collected. Each applicant should then apply in person after taking a Mandatory Appointment. There are two ways in taking an appointment, depending on the nature of the visa applied for.

 

For family reunification visas for spouses and children of Bangladeshi citizens settled in    France, call one of the following numbers: +88 02 5566 8600 or +88 02 5566 8604

Embassy of the Federal Republic of Germany

11 Madani Avenue,
Baridhara Diplomatic Enclave,
Dhaka – 1212, Bangladesh
Phone: (+88) 02 5566 8650, (+88) 02 885 3521-24,
(+88) 02 9853521, ext. 153
Fax: (+88) 02 985 3260
Website: http://www.dhaka.diplo.de/
Email: visa@dhaka.diplo.de

Appointments for Visa:

The Visa Counter is closed on Sundays. The Visa Section will accept applications from Monday to Thursday from 9.00 am to 11.30 am. For applications, you are kindly requested to make an appointment at the German Embassy in Dhaka. Appointments cannot be done through telephone or email anymore.

Schengen visa (Short-term visa for business trips, visits of family or friends and tourist purposes)

If you are a national of Bangladesh and want to travel to Germany for business trips, visits of family or friends and tourist purposes, you need a short term Schengen visa. For applications, you are kindly requested to make an appointment at the German Embassy in Dhaka. If all your documents are correct and complete, a decision on your visa application can usually be made within seven days after the appointment.
body.right_template_two:
Schengen file processing along with appointment fee = 5000 BDT

Visa processing time is 10 to 15 working days (Time may vary depending on the applicant’s profile and the embassy actually processing time)

body.left_template:
Schengen (“C”-Type) visa application form, original Form must be duly filled in English or Italian, and signed by the applicant (if the applicant is a minor, the form must be signed by both parents or its legal guardian)

 

Two recent and identical photos. Photos must be ICAO format (4.0 x 3.5 cm, color photo with white background, taken within the last 6 months)

Valid Passport, original + 1 copy of pages 2 and 3 only (i.e the pages containing only the passport data and personal data) Passport must be valid for at least 3 months after planned departure date from 

Schengen area. The passport must have at least two blank and unmarked visa pages. 

 

If visiting family or friends residing Invitation letter in the format that can be downloaded in the respective section of VFS Web page , proof of family/ties with the inviting person, copy of ID of inviting person and copy of residence permit if foreigner

 

If working: Employment letter , in original Letter from the employer in English on official company paper with stamp, signature and date, introducing the business person and clearly mentioning: address, telephone and fax numbers of the employing company; the name and position in the employing company of the countersigning officer; the name of the applicant, position, salary and years of service; approval for leave; confirmation of position after return 

 

In case the applicant is a self-employed: Trade licence issued by City Corporation and Incorporation Certificate issued by Office of Registrar of Joint Stock Company Income tax return TIN Certificate Company bank statement of the last 6 months

 

In case the applicant is a student: Proof of enrolment in educational establishment in Bangladesh Certificate of leave absence if travelling during school year. The certificate should mention full address, telephone number, permission of absence, name and function of the person granting permission If school trip: letter of the school mentioning the purpose, duration and destination of the trip

 

Proof of financial means of the applicant Personal bank statement issued by any bank operating in Bangladesh covering the last 6 months complemented by any other proof of financial solvency (credit card statements etc.). If the applicants does not have sufficient own financial means a bank fidejussion (Fidejussione Bancaria) issued by an Italian bank is necessary

 

Return airline ticket booking with Passenger Registration Number or Reservation Number and travel itinerary

 

Hotel Confirmation or any other documents proving accommodation for the whole period of stay in the Schengen member States

 

Travel Insurance Insurance must be valid for the whole Schengen area. The insurance must cover medical fees, hospitalization and repatriation costs up to 30,000 Euros. The insurance must fully cover the whole period of stay within the Schengen area. 

 

Documents related to civil status of the applicant For married applicants: marriage certificate (e.g.“Nika Namah” for muslims or marriage act for hindus, both translated in English) For divorced applicants: divorce certificate (e.g. “Talak Namah” for muslims in English) For widowers and widows: death certificate of the spouse in English

 

In case of minors applying for visa Consent of both parents or custodian if both parents are not travelling together Photocopy of passport of parents or legal guardian Proof of financial means of parents or legal guardian (see point 6) Original birth certificate of the minor issued by the relevant authority The status of “legal guardian” must be proven by documents issued by the relevant Bangladeshi Courts for minors 

 

For Non-Bangladeshi applicants: Further than all documents listed on the present check-list, Bangladeshi Residence Permit valid at least 3 months beyond the intended date of departure from the territory of the Member States

For Business Visa Additional Documents

Covering Letter from applicant name, designation, Passport Number, purpose and outlining who will be responsible for the full costs of the trip – travel, accommodation, expenses etc. Addressed to – The Visa Officer, Embassy of Germany, Dhaka.

Invitation from the inviting company or organization stating the purpose of the journey (meetings, conferences, training or business related events).

Forwarding Letter / NOC from the applicant’s company authority on the company’s letter head stating applicant’s name, designation, passport number, purpose and duration of visit.

Visa request letter from the educational institute or student card/evidence of school enrollment (if student)

Company registration certificate (original notarized English translated and photocopy of the original) if the applicant is a first-time traveler or a proprietor.

Office ID card copy & Visiting cards.

body.right_template_one:
Greece is a member of the Schengen countries along with Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, Italy, Germany, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland. A Schengen visa issued for Greece allows you to travel in all Schengen countries.

The Embassy of Italy is handling the visa matters for the Embassy of Greece. Therefore, please apply for your Schengen visa for Greece through the Embassy of Italy.

Plot 2/3, Road 74/79
Gulshan 2, Dhaka 1212,
Bangldesh

Fax: (+88) 02 882 3337

Applicants wishing to lodge visa applications are requested to enter the visa application center between:09:00 – 12:00 hrs
Legalization 14:00 – 15:00 hrs
Passport /Document delivery: 15:00 – 16:00 hrs

 

If you require any consultancy regarding the visa application, VisaThing! Will provide the consultancy service for preparing your documents.

While applying for the long term visa (D Category), an applicant needs to attend Greece Embassy in New Delhi in person. However, if the applicant is able to provide reasonable justification toward the Embassy of Greece, he/she can apply through a third party upon the permission granted by the embassy or consular section. Also, if the inviter can justify properly regarding applicant’s position of being unable to travel India for visa application, the embassy may provide a permission to apply through an agent.

Website: www.mfa.gr/india

However, if the applicant is able to provide reasonable justification toward the Embassy of Greece, he/she can apply through a third party upon the permission granted by the embassy or consular section. Also, if the inviter can justify properly regarding applicant’s position of being unable to travel India for visa application, the embassy may provide a permission to apply through an agent.

Chanakyapuri, New Delhi-110021,
India

Emergency tel: (+91) 96 5461 6196
Fax: (+91) 11 2688 8010, (+91) 11 2467 5231

Website: www.mfa.gr/india

Schengen Business file processing along with appointment fee = 5000 BDT

Visa processing time is 10 to 15 working days (Time may vary depending on the applicant’s profile and the embassy actually processing time)

body.left_template:
General Documents for Business Visa:

  1. Latest passport copies(all pages)including visas and endorsements (Original Passport must be shown at the time of submitting visa application)
  2. Copy of previous passports and visas issued.
  3. Hong Kong (SAR China) Visa Application Form Application form – ID1003A & ID1003B must be signed by the applicant. ID1003B must be filled by the sponsor with sign & seal and copy of Hong Kong identity card or filled by applicants with the information of the invitation letter from Hong Kong. Form – ID520 (Applicant’s Family Background) must be filled and signed by the applicant.
  4. Authorization letter (Must be filled and signed by the applicant).
  5. Two recent passport size photographs with 60-80% face coverage, white background and without border (Size: 35mm x 45mm)
  6. Covering Letter from applicant name, designation, Passport Number, purpose and outlining who will be responsible for the full costs of the trip – travel, accommodation, expenses etc. Addressed to – The Visa Officer, Embassy of Hong Kong (SAR China), Dhaka.
  7. Invitation letter from company in Hong Kong mentioning purpose of visit, length of stay, number of visits required and taking the responsibility of repatriation of the applicant
  8. Forwarding Letter / NOC from the applicant’s company authority on the company’s letter head stating applicant’s name, designation, passport number, purpose and duration of visit.
  9. Visa request letter from the educational institute or student card/evidence of school enrollment (if student)
  10. Company registration certificate (original notarized English translated and photocopy of the original)
  11. Office ID card copy & Visiting cards.
  12. Income Tax Certificate(Tin) copy.
  13. Company’s or Personal Bank Statement for last six months mentioning the Bank’s name, Bank’s Telephone Number clearly.
  14. Salary slip for the last six months. (If Any)
  15. Marriage certificate in English with notary. (If traveling with spouse)
  16. Ticket & Hotel Reservation: Ticket Itinerary and Hotel Booking (If one can manage invitation letter & if it’s written in that invitation letter that he/she can live invitation sender’s house or all expenses will be beard by person. Then no need of Hotel booking)
body.right_template_one:
The Chinese Embassy is only mandated to issue limited kinds of visas for Hong Kong.

You have to apply at the Immigration Office in Hong Kong to get the visa. An applicant may choose any of the below two processes:

Process 1: An applicant can submit passport copy and all the necessary documents listed below at Dragon Airlines and pay the necessary fees. They will submit your application at Hong Kong Immigration Department for visa approval. Once the visa is approved, then the immigration will send a visa sticker to the applicant. Through that visa, an applicant can fly to Hong Kong.

Process 2: An applicant get the immigration approval through the Host Company or Tour Operators in Hong Kong. They need to apply on behalf of applicant at the Immigration Department with the fee. The processing time is at least 35 days in both processes.

body.left_template:
Schengen (“C”-Type) visa application form, original Form must be duly filled in English or Italian, and signed by the applicant (if the applicant is a minor, the form must be signed by both parents or its legal guardian)

 

Business Documents
Covering Letter from applicant name, designation, Passport Number, purpose and outlining who will be responsible for the full costs of the trip – travel, accommodation, expenses etc. Addressed to – The Visa Officer, Embassy of Germany, Dhaka.

Invitation from the inviting company or organization stating the purpose of the journey (meetings, conferences, training or business related events).

Forwarding Letter / NOC from the applicant’s company authority on the company’s letter head stating applicant’s name, designation, passport number, purpose and duration of visit.

Visa request letter from the educational institute or student card/evidence of school enrollment (if student)

Company registration certificate (original notarized English translated and photocopy of the original) if the applicant is a first-time traveler or a proprietor.

Office ID card copy & Visiting cards.

 

Two recent and identical photos. Photos must be ICAO format (4.0 x 3.5 cm, color photo with white background, taken within the last 6 months)

Valid Passport, original + 1 copy of pages 2 and 3 only (i.e the pages containing only the passport data and personal data) Passport must be valid for at least 3 months after planned departure date from 

Schengen area. The passport must have at least two blank and unmarked visa pages. 

 

If visiting family or friends residing Invitation letter in the format that can be downloaded in the respective section of VFS Web page , proof of family/ties with the inviting person, copy of ID of inviting person and copy of residence permit if foreigner

 

If working: Employment letter , in original Letter from the employer in English on official company paper with stamp, signature and date, introducing the business person and clearly mentioning: address, telephone and fax numbers of the employing company; the name and position in the employing company of the countersigning officer; the name of the applicant, position, salary and years of service; approval for leave; confirmation of position after return 

 

In case the applicant is a self-employed: Trade licence issued by City Corporation and Incorporation Certificate issued by Office of Registrar of Joint Stock Company Income tax return TIN Certificate Company bank statement of the last 6 months

 

In case the applicant is a student: Proof of enrolment in educational establishment in Bangladesh Certificate of leave absence if travelling during school year. The certificate should mention full address, telephone number, permission of absence, name and function of the person granting permission If school trip: letter of the school mentioning the purpose, duration and destination of the trip

 

Proof of financial means of the applicant Personal bank statement issued by any bank operating in Bangladesh covering the last 6 months complemented by any other proof of financial solvency (credit card statements etc.). If the applicants does not have sufficient own financial means a bank fidejussion (Fidejussione Bancaria) issued by an Italian bank is necessary

 

Return airline ticket booking with Passenger Registration Number or Reservation Number and travel itinerary

 

Hotel Confirmation or any other documents proving accommodation for the whole period of stay in the Schengen member States

 

Travel Insurance Insurance must be valid for the whole Schengen area. The insurance must cover medical fees, hospitalization and repatriation costs up to 30,000 Euros. The insurance must fully cover the whole period of stay within the Schengen area. 

 

Documents related to civil status of the applicant For married applicants: marriage certificate (e.g.“Nika Namah” for muslims or marriage act for hindus, both translated in English) For divorced applicants: divorce certificate (e.g. “Talak Namah” for muslims in English) For widowers and widows: death certificate of the spouse in English

 

In case of minors applying for visa Consent of both parents or custodian if both parents are not travelling together Photocopy of passport of parents or legal guardian Proof of financial means of parents or legal guardian (see point 6) Original birth certificate of the minor issued by the relevant authority The status of “legal guardian” must be proven by documents issued by the relevant Bangladeshi Courts for minors 

 

For Non-Bangladeshi applicants: Further than all documents listed on the present check-list, Bangladeshi Residence Permit valid at least 3 months beyond the intended date of departure from the territory of the Member States

Embassy of Sweden
Bay’s Edgewater, 6th Floor, Plot No.12,
North avenue, Gulshan 2, Dhaka 1212
Telephone: (+88) 02 5566 8500
Fax: (+88) 02 882 3948
Email: ambassaden.dhaka-visum@ gov.se
General opening hours:
Sunday to Thursday: 08.00-16.00

 

The Swedish Embassy has an appointment system. In order to get an appointment you are required to visit the following external service provider (not applicable for online applications).

Sweden Visa Application Centre
Delta Life Tower, Plot 37, Road 90,
Gulshan North, Gulshan-2, Dhaka
Helpline No: (+88) 09 606 777 333, (Sunday to Thursday 09:00 to 17:00)
Email: info.swedenbd@vfshelpline.com
Website: www.vfsglobal.se/Bangladesh/Index.html

 

The following should be taken into account even if holding a Visa:
Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay and documents required for their next destination.

 

Certain Visa regulations apply as follows:
Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused for entry visa.

 

Health:
This information is for guide purposes only. Other health organizations may recommend alternative precautions. Vaccinations not required.

In case the applicant is a self-employed: Trade licence issued by City Corporation and Incorporation Certificate issued by Office of Registrar of Joint Stock Company Income tax return TIN Certificate Company bank statement of the last 6 months

 

In case the applicant is a student: Proof of enrolment in educational establishment in Bangladesh Certificate of leave absence if travelling during school year. The certificate should mention full address, telephone number, permission of absence, name and function of the person granting permission If school trip: letter of the school mentioning the purpose, duration and destination of the trip

 

Proof of financial means of the applicant Personal bank statement issued by any bank operating in Bangladesh covering the last 6 months complemented by any other proof of financial solvency (credit card statements etc.). If the applicants does not have sufficient own financial means a bank fidejussion (Fidejussione Bancaria) issued by an Italian bank is necessary

 

Return airline ticket booking with Passenger Registration Number or Reservation Number and travel itinerary

 

Hotel Confirmation or any other documents proving accommodation for the whole period of stay in the Schengen member States

 

Travel Insurance Insurance must be valid for the whole Schengen area. The insurance must cover medical fees, hospitalization and repatriation costs up to 30,000 Euros. The insurance must fully cover the whole period of stay within the Schengen area. 

 

Documents related to civil status of the applicant For married applicants: marriage certificate (e.g.“Nika Namah” for muslims or marriage act for hindus, both translated in English) For divorced applicants: divorce certificate (e.g. “Talak Namah” for muslims in English) For widowers and widows: death certificate of the spouse in English

 

In case of minors applying for visa Consent of both parents or custodian if both parents are not travelling together Photocopy of passport of parents or legal guardian Proof of financial means of parents or legal guardian (see point 6) Original birth certificate of the minor issued by the relevant authority The status of “legal guardian” must be proven by documents issued by the relevant Bangladeshi Courts for minors 

 

For Non-Bangladeshi applicants: Further than all documents listed on the present check-list, Bangladeshi Residence Permit valid at least 3 months beyond the intended date of departure from the territory of the Member States

Italy is a member of the Schengen countries along with Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

Application Centre 
Russel park (1st Floor), House -101, Road – 13/A,
Block – C, Banani, Dhaka – 1213, Bangladesh
Helpline: (+88) 09 606 777 666

Sunday to Thursday: 09:00 – 13:00 hrs and 14:00 – 16:00 hrs

body.right_template_two:
Schengen file processing along with appointment fee = 5000 BDT

Visa processing time is 10 to 15 working days (Time may vary depending on the applicant’s profile and the embassy actually processing time)

body.left_template:
Schengen Tourist (“C”-Type) visa application form, original Form must be duly filled in English or Italian, and signed by the applicant (if the applicant is a minor, the form must be signed by both parents or its legal guardian)

 

Two recent and identical photos. Photos must be ICAO format (4.0 x 3.5 cm, color photo with white background, taken within the last 6 months)

Valid Passport, original + 1 copy of pages 2 and 3 only (i.e the pages containing only the passport data and personal data) Passport must be valid for at least 3 months after planned departure date from 

Schengen area. The passport must have at least two blank and unmarked visa pages. 

 

If visiting family or friends residing Invitation letter in the format that can be downloaded in the respective section of VFS Web page , proof of family/ties with the inviting person, copy of ID of inviting person and copy of residence permit if foreigner

 

If working: Employment letter , in original Letter from the employer in English on official company paper with stamp, signature and date, introducing the business person and clearly mentioning: address, telephone and fax numbers of the employing company; the name and position in the employing company of the countersigning officer; the name of the applicant, position, salary and years of service; approval for leave; confirmation of position after return 

 

In case the applicant is a self-employed: Trade licence issued by City Corporation and Incorporation Certificate issued by Office of Registrar of Joint Stock Company Income tax return TIN Certificate Company bank statement of the last 6 months

 

In case the applicant is a student: Proof of enrolment in educational establishment in Bangladesh Certificate of leave absence if travelling during school year. The certificate should mention full address, telephone number, permission of absence, name and function of the person granting permission If school trip: letter of the school mentioning the purpose, duration and destination of the trip

 

Proof of financial means of the applicant Personal bank statement issued by any bank operating in Bangladesh covering the last 6 months complemented by any other proof of financial solvency (credit card statements etc.). If the applicants does not have sufficient own financial means a bank fidejussion (Fidejussione Bancaria) issued by an Italian bank is necessary

 

Return airline ticket booking with Passenger Registration Number or Reservation Number and travel itinerary

 

Hotel Confirmation or any other documents proving accommodation for the whole period of stay in the Schengen member States

 

Travel Insurance Insurance must be valid for the whole Schengen area. The insurance must cover medical fees, hospitalization and repatriation costs up to 30,000 Euros. The insurance must fully cover the whole period of stay within the Schengen area. 

 

Documents related to civil status of the applicant For married applicants: marriage certificate (e.g.“Nika Namah” for muslims or marriage act for hindus, both translated in English) For divorced applicants: divorce certificate (e.g. “Talak Namah” for muslims in English) For widowers and widows: death certificate of the spouse in English

 

In case of minors applying for visa Consent of both parents or custodian if both parents are not travelling together Photocopy of passport of parents or legal guardian Proof of financial means of parents or legal guardian (see point 6) Original birth certificate of the minor issued by the relevant authority The status of “legal guardian” must be proven by documents issued by the relevant Bangladeshi Courts for minors 

 

For Non-Bangladeshi applicants: Further than all documents listed on the present check-list, Bangladeshi Residence Permit valid at least 3 months beyond the intended date of departure from the territory of the Member States 




For Business Visa Additional Documents

A covering letter stating the purpose of visit and itinerary.

Invitation from the inviting company or organization stating the purpose of the journey (meetings, conferences, training or business related events).

Forwarding Letter / NOC from the applicant’s company authority on the company’s letter head stating applicant’s name, designation, passport number, purpose and duration of visit.

Visa request letter from the educational institute or student card/evidence of school enrollment (if student)

Company registration certificate (original notarized English translated and photocopy of the original) if the applicant is a first-time traveler or a proprietor.

Office ID card copy & Visiting cards.

In case the applicant is a student: Proof of enrolment in educational establishment in Bangladesh Certificate of leave absence if travelling during school year. The certificate should mention full address, telephone number, permission of absence, name and function of the person granting permission If school trip: letter of the school mentioning the purpose, duration and destination of the trip

 

Proof of financial means of the applicant Personal bank statement issued by any bank operating in Bangladesh covering the last 6 months complemented by any other proof of financial solvency (credit card statements etc.). If the applicants does not have sufficient own financial means a bank fidejussion (Fidejussione Bancaria) issued by an Italian bank is necessary

 

Return airline ticket booking with Passenger Registration Number or Reservation Number and travel itinerary

 

Hotel Confirmation or any other documents proving accommodation for the whole period of stay in the Schengen member States

 

Travel Insurance Insurance must be valid for the whole Schengen area. The insurance must cover medical fees, hospitalization and repatriation costs up to 30,000 Euros. The insurance must fully cover the whole period of stay within the Schengen area. 

 

Documents related to civil status of the applicant For married applicants: marriage certificate (e.g.“Nika Namah” for muslims or marriage act for hindus, both translated in English) For divorced applicants: divorce certificate (e.g. “Talak Namah” for muslims in English) For widowers and widows: death certificate of the spouse in English

 

In case of minors applying for visa Consent of both parents or custodian if both parents are not travelling together Photocopy of passport of parents or legal guardian Proof of financial means of parents or legal guardian (see point 6) Original birth certificate of the minor issued by the relevant authority The status of “legal guardian” must be proven by documents issued by the relevant Bangladeshi Courts for minors 

 

For Non-Bangladeshi applicants: Further than all documents listed on the present check-list, Bangladeshi Residence Permit valid at least 3 months beyond the intended date of departure from the territory of the Member States
body.right_template_one:
Switzerland and Liechtenstein share the same entry requirements. The provisions concerning persons requiring visas are identical. Individuals requiring Liechtenstein visa may submit an application to the Swiss representation in their country of residence. The Swiss authorities decide on the request.

365 days a year – around the clock

body.right_template_one:
Honorary Consulate of the Republic of Lithuania in Bangladesh
Bitopi Group
Corporate Office
822/3, Begum Rokeya Sharani
Mirpur, Dhaka-1216
Bangladesh
Email: zoynab@bitopibd.com
Phone: (+88) 018 7100 1399 (mob.), (+88) 02 902 3757,
Fax: (+88) 02 902 3714
Working hours: Sunday-Thursday, 9.00 am -17.00 pm

Information about visas:

For short visit or tourist visit, you can apply for Schengen visa.  Lithuania is a member of the Schengen countries along with Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

The Honorary Consulate of the Republic of Lithuania in Bangladesh only provide support for checking the documents required to get the visa and connect the applicant toward the Lithuanian Embassy in New Delhi, from where the visa is been issued. The Consular Office in Bangladesh does not provide any visa.

Both for short term Schengen (C category) visa and long term (D category) visa, an applicant has to apply in the nearest Lithuanian Embassy in New Delhi. Bio-metric information of the applicant is required at the time of submitting the application in New Delhi; so the applicant has to be there in person to apply and process the visa.

Lithuania Embassy in India:

C-93, Anand Niketan,
New Delhi-110021
INDIA
Telephone: (+91) 11 4313 2200
Fax: (+91) 11 4313 2222
E-mail: amb.in@urm.lt

Two recent and identical photos. Photos must be ICAO format (4.0 x 3.5 cm, color photo with white background, taken within the last 6 months)

Valid Passport, original + 1 copy of pages 2 and 3 only (i.e the pages containing only the passport data and personal data) Passport must be valid for at least 3 months after planned departure date from 

Schengen area. The passport must have at least two blank and unmarked visa pages. 

 

If visiting family or friends residing Invitation letter in the format that can be downloaded in the respective section of VFS Web page , proof of family/ties with the inviting person, copy of ID of inviting person and copy of residence permit if foreigner

 

If working: Employment letter , in original Letter from the employer in English on official company paper with stamp, signature and date, introducing the business person and clearly mentioning: address, telephone and fax numbers of the employing company; the name and position in the employing company of the countersigning officer; the name of the applicant, position, salary and years of service; approval for leave; confirmation of position after return 

 

In case the applicant is a self-employed: Trade licence issued by City Corporation and Incorporation Certificate issued by Office of Registrar of Joint Stock Company Income tax return TIN Certificate Company bank statement of the last 6 months

 

In case the applicant is a student: Proof of enrolment in educational establishment in Bangladesh Certificate of leave absence if travelling during school year. The certificate should mention full address, telephone number, permission of absence, name and function of the person granting permission If school trip: letter of the school mentioning the purpose, duration and destination of the trip

 

Proof of financial means of the applicant Personal bank statement issued by any bank operating in Bangladesh covering the last 6 months complemented by any other proof of financial solvency (credit card statements etc.). If the applicants does not have sufficient own financial means a bank fidejussion (Fidejussione Bancaria) issued by an Italian bank is necessary

 

Return airline ticket booking with Passenger Registration Number or Reservation Number and travel itinerary

 

Hotel Confirmation or any other documents proving accommodation for the whole period of stay in the Schengen member States

 

Travel Insurance Insurance must be valid for the whole Schengen area. The insurance must cover medical fees, hospitalization and repatriation costs up to 30,000 Euros. The insurance must fully cover the whole period of stay within the Schengen area. 

 

Documents related to civil status of the applicant For married applicants: marriage certificate (e.g.“Nika Namah” for muslims or marriage act for hindus, both translated in English) For divorced applicants: divorce certificate (e.g. “Talak Namah” for muslims in English) For widowers and widows: death certificate of the spouse in English

 

In case of minors applying for visa Consent of both parents or custodian if both parents are not travelling together Photocopy of passport of parents or legal guardian Proof of financial means of parents or legal guardian (see point 6) Original birth certificate of the minor issued by the relevant authority The status of “legal guardian” must be proven by documents issued by the relevant Bangladeshi Courts for minors 

 

For Non-Bangladeshi applicants: Further than all documents listed on the present check-list, Bangladeshi Residence Permit valid at least 3 months beyond the intended date of departure from the territory of the Member States

When you are thinking of a visit to Malaysia from Bangladesh be aware of current Malaysian visa requirements and regulations as these tend to change overnight. There are different types of visa that are available for foreigners intending to enter Malaysia from Bangladesh and you will have to make sure that you apply for the correct visa that is suited to the purpose of your trip to Malaysia.

Schengen area. The passport must have at least two blank and unmarked visa pages. 

 

If visiting family or friends residing Invitation letter in the format that can be downloaded in the respective section of VFS Web page , proof of family/ties with the inviting person, copy of ID of inviting person and copy of residence permit if foreigner

 

If working: Employment letter , in original Letter from the employer in English on official company paper with stamp, signature and date, introducing the business person and clearly mentioning: address, telephone and fax numbers of the employing company; the name and position in the employing company of the countersigning officer; the name of the applicant, position, salary and years of service; approval for leave; confirmation of position after return 

 

In case the applicant is a self-employed: Trade licence issued by City Corporation and Incorporation Certificate issued by Office of Registrar of Joint Stock Company Income tax return TIN Certificate Company bank statement of the last 6 months

 

In case the applicant is a student: Proof of enrolment in educational establishment in Bangladesh Certificate of leave absence if travelling during school year. The certificate should mention full address, telephone number, permission of absence, name and function of the person granting permission If school trip: letter of the school mentioning the purpose, duration and destination of the trip

 

Proof of financial means of the applicant Personal bank statement issued by any bank operating in Bangladesh covering the last 6 months complemented by any other proof of financial solvency (credit card statements etc.). If the applicants does not have sufficient own financial means a bank fidejussion (Fidejussione Bancaria) issued by an Italian bank is necessary

 

Return airline ticket booking with Passenger Registration Number or Reservation Number and travel itinerary

 

Hotel Confirmation or any other documents proving accommodation for the whole period of stay in the Schengen member States

 

Travel Insurance Insurance must be valid for the whole Schengen area. The insurance must cover medical fees, hospitalization and repatriation costs up to 30,000 Euros. The insurance must fully cover the whole period of stay within the Schengen area. 

 

Documents related to civil status of the applicant For married applicants: marriage certificate (e.g.“Nika Namah” for muslims or marriage act for hindus, both translated in English) For divorced applicants: divorce certificate (e.g. “Talak Namah” for muslims in English) For widowers and widows: death certificate of the spouse in English

 

In case of minors applying for visa Consent of both parents or custodian if both parents are not travelling together Photocopy of passport of parents or legal guardian Proof of financial means of parents or legal guardian (see point 6) Original birth certificate of the minor issued by the relevant authority The status of “legal guardian” must be proven by documents issued by the relevant Bangladeshi Courts for minors 

 

For Non-Bangladeshi applicants: Further than all documents listed on the present check-list, Bangladeshi Residence Permit valid at least 3 months beyond the intended date of departure from the territory of the Member States 


For Business Visa Additional Documents

A covering letter stating the purpose of visit to Malta and itinerary.

Invitation from the inviting company or organization stating the purpose of the journey (meetings, conferences, training or business related events).

Forwarding Letter / NOC from the applicant’s company authority on the company’s letter head stating applicant’s name, designation, passport number, purpose and duration of visit.

Visa request letter from the educational institute or student card/evidence of school enrollment (if student)

Company registration certificate (original notarized English translated and photocopy of the original) if the applicant is a first-time traveler or a proprietor.

Office ID card copy & Visiting cards.

body.right_template_one:
Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Dhaka:
Address: Road 90, House 49,
Gulshan 2, Dhaka
Postal Address: P.O. Box 166 ,Dhaka
Telephone: (+88) 02 984 2715 – 18, (+88) 02 988 1647 – 50
Fax: (+88) 02 882 3326
E-mail: dha@minbuza.nl
Opening hours (Embassy): Sunday – Thursday : 08.00 – 16.00 hrs.
Opening hours (consular department): Wednesday morning: 9.00 – 12.00 hrs

Visa information:
If you want to stay in the Netherlands for up to 90 days, you may require a Schengen visa. As from 1 June 2012, the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands no longer issues Schengen visa. Travelers who plan to visit the Netherlands or Belgium for a visit less than three months can apply for a Schengen visa at the Embassy of Sweden in Dhaka through Sweden Visa Application Center.

The Swedish Embassy has an appointment system. In order to get an appointment you are required to visit the following external service provider (not applicable for online applications).

Sweden Visa Application Centre
Delta Life Tower, Plot 37, Road 90,
Gulshan North, Gulshan-2, Dhaka
Helpline No: (+88) 09 606 777 333, (Sunday to Thursday 09:00 to 17:00)
Email: info.swedenbd@vfshelpline.com
Website: www.vfsglobal.se/Bangladesh/Index.html

body.right_template_two:
Schengen file processing along with appointment fee = 5000 BDT

Visa processing time is 10 to 15 working days (Time may vary depending on the applicant’s profile and the embassy actually processing time)

body.left_template:
Schengen Tourist (“C”-Type) visa application form, original Form must be duly filled in English or Italian, and signed by the applicant (if the applicant is a minor, the form must be signed by both parents or its legal guardian)

 

Two recent and identical photos. Photos must be ICAO format (4.0 x 3.5 cm, color photo with white background, taken within the last 6 months)

Valid Passport, original + 1 copy of pages 2 and 3 only (i.e the pages containing only the passport data and personal data) Passport must be valid for at least 3 months after planned departure date from 

Schengen area. The passport must have at least two blank and unmarked visa pages. 

 

If visiting family or friends residing Invitation letter in the format that can be downloaded in the respective section of VFS Web page , proof of family/ties with the inviting person, copy of ID of inviting person and copy of residence permit if foreigner

 

If working: Employment letter , in original Letter from the employer in English on official company paper with stamp, signature and date, introducing the business person and clearly mentioning: address, telephone and fax numbers of the employing company; the name and position in the employing company of the countersigning officer; the name of the applicant, position, salary and years of service; approval for leave; confirmation of position after return 

 

In case the applicant is a self-employed: Trade licence issued by City Corporation and Incorporation Certificate issued by Office of Registrar of Joint Stock Company Income tax return TIN Certificate Company bank statement of the last 6 months

 

In case the applicant is a student: Proof of enrolment in educational establishment in Bangladesh Certificate of leave absence if travelling during school year. The certificate should mention full address, telephone number, permission of absence, name and function of the person granting permission If school trip: letter of the school mentioning the purpose, duration and destination of the trip

 

Proof of financial means of the applicant Personal bank statement issued by any bank operating in Bangladesh covering the last 6 months complemented by any other proof of financial solvency (credit card statements etc.). If the applicants does not have sufficient own financial means a bank fidejussion (Fidejussione Bancaria) issued by an Italian bank is necessary

 

Return airline ticket booking with Passenger Registration Number or Reservation Number and travel itinerary

 

Hotel Confirmation or any other documents proving accommodation for the whole period of stay in the Schengen member States

 

Travel Insurance Insurance must be valid for the whole Schengen area. The insurance must cover medical fees, hospitalization and repatriation costs up to 30,000 Euros. The insurance must fully cover the whole period of stay within the Schengen area. 

 

Documents related to civil status of the applicant For married applicants: marriage certificate (e.g.“Nika Namah” for muslims or marriage act for hindus, both translated in English) For divorced applicants: divorce certificate (e.g. “Talak Namah” for muslims in English) For widowers and widows: death certificate of the spouse in English

 

In case of minors applying for visa Consent of both parents or custodian if both parents are not travelling together Photocopy of passport of parents or legal guardian Proof of financial means of parents or legal guardian (see point 6) Original birth certificate of the minor issued by the relevant authority The status of “legal guardian” must be proven by documents issued by the relevant Bangladeshi Courts for minors 

 

For Non-Bangladeshi applicants: Further than all documents listed on the present check-list, Bangladeshi Residence Permit valid at least 3 months beyond the intended date of departure from the territory of the Member States 




For Business Visa Additional Documents

Business Documents
Covering Letter from applicant name, designation, Passport Number, purpose and outlining who will be responsible for the full costs of the trip – travel, accommodation, expenses etc. Addressed to – The Visa Officer, Embassy of Norway, Dhaka.

Invitation from the inviting company or organization stating the purpose of the journey (meetings, conferences, training or business related events).

Forwarding Letter / NOC from the applicant’s company authority on the company’s letter head stating applicant’s name, designation, passport number, purpose and duration of visit.

Visa request letter from the educational institute or student card/evidence of school enrollment (if student)

Company registration certificate (original notarized English translated and photocopy of the original) if the applicant is a first-time traveler or a proprietor.

Office ID card copy & Visiting cards.

body.right_template_one:
For Schengen “C” and “A” visas Bangladesh nationals residing in that country, planning to travel to Poland, should submit their applications at the Embassy of Sweden in Dhaka:

 

Embassy of Sweden:
Bay’s Edgewater, 6th Floor,
Plot No. 12, North Avenue,
Gulshan 2, Dhaka-1212
Bangladesh

 

Opening hours:
Submitting applications: Sunday-Tuesday 9:00-12:00
Receiving endorsed passports: Sunday-Tuesday 13:00-14:00
Visa Section telephone inquiries: Sunday-Tuesday 13:00-14:00

 

To know detail about Schengen Visa information, please Click Here

 

The Swedish Embassy has an appointment system for visa process. In order to get an appointment you are required to visit the following external service provider (not applicable for online applications):

Sweden Visa Application Centre
Delta Life Tower, Plot 37, Road 90,
Gulshan North, Gulshan-2, Dhaka
Helpline No: (+88) 09 606 777 333, (Sunday to Thursday 09:00 to 17:00)
Email: info.swedenbd@vfshelpline.com
Website: www.vfsglobal.se/Bangladesh/Index.html

 

Information about Schengen visas:

Poland is a member of the Schengen countries along with others. So you can directly apply for Schengen visa.

 

For Polish National “D” visa, you need to apply in the Embassy of the Republic of Poland in New Delhi.

 

Embassy of the Republic of Poland In New Delhi
Consular Division
50-M Shantipath, Chanakyapuri,
New Delhi, 110021
Phone: (+91) 11 4149 6975, (+91) 11 4149 6904
(in English and Hindi, between 2 and 4 pm)
Fax: (+91) 11 4149 6974
E-mail: newdelhi.amb.wk@msz.gov.pl
Website: http://newdelhi.mfa.gov.pl/en/
Office hours: Monday – Friday, 08:15 – 16:15

 

Applicant have to get prior appointment to submit to the Embassy in New Delhi on his own. It is only applicable for Polish National “D” visa; long term visa for a stay over 90 and up to 365 days in Poland. Please note that the national visa allows to stay in other Schengen countries for up to 90 days per each 180 days. The National visa is usually granted as multiple entry visa.

body.right_template_one:
Honorary Consulate of Portugal in Dhaka:
House No. 19 B,Road No. 117/120
Gulshan, Dhaka-1212
Bangladesh

But, The Embassy of France is controlling the visa matters of the Embassy of Portugal. Therefore, please apply for your Schengen visa (“C” category) for Portugal through the Embassy of France.

Embassy of France:
Road 108, House 18, Gulshan, Dhaka 1212
Tel: (+88) 02 5881 3811 – 14
FAX: (+88) 02 5881 3612
E-mail: ambafrance@gononet.com
Website: www.ambafrance-bd.org

Information about Schengen visas:

However, for long-term national visas (for research, study, work or family reunification), the residents of Bangladesh have to submit their applications to the Embassy of Portugal in New Delhi to get Portugal visa from Bangladesh. Applications will only be accepted if Portugal represents the main destination of the intended travel considering the length of stay.

VFS Portugal Visa Application Centre
No. 15-26, Block E, 2nd Floor,
International Trade Tower,
Nehru Place, New Delhi-110019
Email: infonorth.ptin@vfshelpline.com , feedback@vfsglobal.com
Phone: (+91) 22 6786 6070
Website: http://pt.vfsglobal.co.in/

Chancery
No.4, Panchsheel Marg
Chanakyapuri
